sen.j: 鎌倉府（かまくらふ）とは、南北朝時代 (日本)から室町時代にかけて、室町幕府が関東を統治するために設置した政庁である。
sen.e: Kamakurafu was a government office which Muromachi bakufu established in the Northern and Southern courts period and the Muromachi period for the purpose of ruling Kanto region.
The Kamakurafu was a government office which the Muromachi bakufu established in the Northern and Southern courts period and the Muromachi period for the purpose of ruling the Kanto region.

The Kamakurafu was a government office which the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) established in the Northern and Southern courts period and the Muromachi period for the purpose of ruling the Kanto region.
sen.cmt: 初出のためbakufuの補足追加

sen.j: 後醍醐天皇が建武の新政の一環として関東統治を目的に皇子・成良親王を奉じて鎌倉へ下向させて創設した鎌倉将軍府が起源。
sen.e: Its origin was Kamakura shogunfu headed by Imperial Prince Nariyoshi, a prince of the Emperor Godaigo, which the emperor Godaigo established, as a part of Kenmu restoration, for the purpose of ruling Kanto region.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Its origin was the Kamakura shogunfu headed by Imperial Prince Nariyoshi, a prince of Emperor Godaigo, which emperor Godaigo established, as a part of the Kenmu restoration, for the purpose of ruling the Kanto region.

Its origin was the Kamakura shogunfu headed by Imperial Prince Nariyoshi, a prince of Emperor Godaigo, which Emperor Godaigo established, as a part of the Kenmu Restoration, for the purpose of ruling the Kanto region.
sen.cmt: emperor、restorationの頭文字を大文字に修正

sen.j: 幼い親王に代わって実権は足利直義に握られ、やがて室町幕府の関東の出先機関となる。
sen.e: Naoyoshi ASHIKAGA seized real power instead of a very young prince, and it later became the local office of Muromachi bakufu in Kanto region.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Naoyoshi ASHIKAGA seized real power instead of a very young prince, and it later became the local office of the Muromachi bakufu in the Kanto region.
Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA seized real power instead of a very young prince, and it later became the local office of the Muromachi bakufu in the Kanto region.

sen.j: 観応の擾乱が発生すると、足利尊氏は子である足利基氏を鎌倉へ派遣した。
sen.e: When the Kanno Disturbance occurred, Takauji ASHIKAGA dispatched his son Motouji ASHIKAGA to Kamakura.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When the Kanno Disturbance occurred, Takauji ASHIKAGA dispatched his son Motouji ASHIKAGA to Kamakura.
When the Kanno Disturbance occurred, Takauji ASHIKAGA dispatched his son Motouji ASHIKAGA to Kamakura.

sen.j: 以来基氏の子孫が鎌倉府の長官（鎌倉公方）となり、関東管領として上杉氏が代々補佐した。
sen.e: Since then, Motouji's descendants inherited the top post of Kamakurafu (Kamakura kubo) and the Uesugi clan supported Kamakura kubo as Kanto kanrei (a shogunal deputy for Kanto region) for generations.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since then, Motouji's descendants inherited the top post of the Kamakurafu (Kamakura kubo) and the Uesugi clan supported Kamakura kubo as Kanto kanrei (a shogunal deputy for Kanto region) for generations.

Since then, Motouji's descendants inherited the top post of the Kamakurafu (Kamakura kubo) and the Uesugi clan supported Kamakura kubo as Kanto kanrei (a shogunal deputy for Kanto region) for generations.

sen.j: 管国は関東地方と伊豆国・甲斐国で、1392年に陸奥国・出羽国が追加された。
sen.e: Its original jurisdiction included Kanto region, Izu Province and Kai Province, and Mutsu Province and Dewa province were added in 1392.
Its original jurisdiction included the Kanto region, Izu Province and Kai Province, and Mutsu Province and Dewa province were added in 1392.
Its original jurisdiction included the Kanto region, Izu Province and Kai Province, and Mutsu Province and Dewa province were added in 1392.

sen.j: 鎌倉公方足利氏と関東管領上杉氏はやがて対立し、1439年の永享の乱では関東管領は将軍足利義教方についた。
sen.e: Kamakura kubo Ashikaga clan and Kanto kanrei Uesugi clan became at odds by and by, and In Eikyo War occurred in 1439, Kanto kanrei sided with shogun Yoshinori ASHIKAGA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Kamakura kubo Ashikaga clan and the Kanto kanrei Uesugi clan became at odds, and the Eikyo War occurred in 1439, where the Kanto kanrei sided with shogun Yoshinori ASHIKAGA.
The Kamakura kubo Ashikaga clan and the Kanto kanrei Uesugi clan became at odds, and the Eikyo War occurred in 1439, where the Kanto kanrei sided with shogun Yoshinori ASHIKAGA.

sen.j: この乱における第4代鎌倉公方足利持氏の敗死によって鎌倉府は長官が一時不在となった。
sen.e: As the 4th Kamakura kubo Mochiuji ASHIKAGA was defeated and killed in this war, the top of Kamakurafu became vacant for a while.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As the 4th Kamakura kubo, Mochiuji ASHIKAGA was defeated and killed in this war, and the top of the Kamakurafu became vacant for a while.
As the fourth Kamakura kubo, Mochiuji ASHIKAGA was defeated and killed in this war, and the top of the Kamakurafu became vacant for a while.

sen.j: その後、持氏の遺児足利成氏が鎌倉公方となるが、享徳の乱を起こして上杉氏や今川氏によって鎌倉を追われて古河御所（古河公方）に逃れた。
sen.e: Although Shigeuji ASHIKAGA, a bereaved son of Mochiuji, became Kamakura kubo, he was forced by the Uesugi clan and the Imagawa clan to move to Koga palace (Koga kubo) after he caused Kyotoku War.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although Shigeuji ASHIKAGA, a bereaved son of Mochiuji, became Kamakura kubo, he was forced by the Uesugi clan and the Imagawa clan to move to Koga palace (Koga kubo) after he caused the Kyotoku War.
Although Shigeuji ASHIKAGA, a bereaved son of Mochiuji, became Kamakura kubo, he was forced by the Uesugi clan and the Imagawa clan to move to Koga palace (Koga kubo) after he caused the Kyotoku War.

sen.j: 代わりに派遣された足利政知（義教の子）も上杉氏との確執から伊豆の堀越御所（堀越公方）に根拠を定めたために鎌倉府は事実上消滅した。
sen.e: As Masatomo ASHIKAGA (Yoshinori's son), who was appointed in place for Shigeuji, was based at Horikoshi palace in Izu Province due to a feud with the Uesugi clan, Kamakurafu ceased to exist in effect.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As Masatomo ASHIKAGA (Yoshinori's son), who was appointed in place of Shigeuji, was based at Horikoshi palace in Izu Province due to a feud with the Uesugi clan, the Kamakurafu ceased to exist in effect.

As Masatomo ASHIKAGA (Yoshinori's son), who was appointed in place of Shigeuji, was based at Horikoshi palace (Horikoshi kubo) in Izu Province due to a feud with the Uesugi clan, the Kamakurafu ceased to exist in effect.
sen.cmt: Horikoshi palace→Horikoshi palace (Horikoshi kubo)としました。
